description: Non-Material Amendment to Planning Permission ref: 20/01521/HOU (Erection of single storey and part first floor rear extension (following demolition of existing ground floor extension and outbuilding). Amendments to consist of changes to fenestration and exterior finish to extension
decision_conditions: Condition 1 of 20/01521/HOU is amended as follows:The approved development shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings/details:0369_E002 SITE LOCATION PLAN AND BLOCK PLAN REV A0363_E003 EXISTING FLOOR PLANS REV A0363_E004 EXISTING ELEVATIONS AND SECTION REV A0369_P002 PROPOSED FLOOR PLANS REV B0369_P004 PROPOSED ELEVATIONS AND SECTION REV BReason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details have been assessed by relevant consultees and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details, in relation to Condition 26 (Structual Details of Retaining Wall) of planning permission 22/00574/FUL which state:Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level (excluding demolition and site investigations), full structural engineering design details regarding the construction of the retaining wall to the eastern site boundary(abutting Selsdon Close), prepared / informed by a suitably qualified structural engineer, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. See Informative 12 for further guidance as to the level of detail required by this condition.The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved details and the retaining wall shall thereafter be permanently retained and maintained. Reason: To ensure a safe development in accordance with Paragraph 184 of the NPPF, 2021.

PLEASE READ CAREFULLY: On the 1st May 2024 the Council adopted a new Householder Local List. Please ensure that your application submission includes all the necessary documentation as required by the new local list. Then please complete and submit a Householder Checklist - Section 3 to confirm that you have provided all mandatory documents. The new Householder Local List and checklists can be obtained via the council's website: https://www.kingston.gov.uk/downloads/download/261/validation-requirements-for-planning-applicationsThe LPA will not conduct any validation checks until the correct Checklist has been submitted. Upon receipt of a completed Checklist, the application will be assigned to a validation officer to review. Please do not simply state N/A anywhere in the checklist without a written justification. If you need to make any changes to your application please try to do this via the Planning Portal website where possible. If that is not possible please send amended documents via the email address quoted in this letter.
